question:
Consider the linear application $T: \mathbb{R}^3\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that 
$$T(1,0,1)=(-2,4), \quad T(0,-1,2)=(5, 0), \quad T(0,0,3)=(-6,3)$$ 
Choose the right answer.

answer1: The set $\left\{(0, 0)\right\}$, all the lines of  $\mathbb{R}^2$ containing $(0, 0)$ and $\mathbb{R}^2$
answer2: The set $\left\{(0, 0)\right\}$, all the lines of  $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $\mathbb{R}^2$

question: Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x &+ &y &- &z &= &1 \\ 
x &+ &y &+ &z &= &2 \\ 
x &- &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,0,1\right)$ and $\left(1,0,-1\right)$ as its solutions.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,0,x\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Consider the unusual scalar product of $\mathbb{R}^3$ defined by $(x_1, y_1)\cdot (x_2, y_2)=4x_1x_2+3y_1y_2$ and consider the vectors $u=(1, -4)$ and $v=(3, 2)$.
The scalar product, $u \cdot v$, and the magnitude of $u$, $|u|$, are respectively:

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
(1+i)z& + & (1-i)w & = & i \\
(1-i)z& + & (1+i)w & = & 1-i
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The unique solution of the linear system is $\bigg(\frac{3+i}{4},-\frac{1+i}{4}\bigg)$.
answer2: The solutions of the linear system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{1+i}{4},\frac{-1+i}{4}+z\bigg)$, for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer3: The linear system has no solutions.
answer4: The linear system has the vector $(i,-i)$ has its unique solution.

question: Indicate which of the following is a subspace of $\mathbb{R}^3$.
Find the integral curve which satisfies the equation $tx'-x=-2t^2x^2$ with initial condition $x(1)=1$.
answer1: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x(2t^3+1)-3t=0$.
answer2: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x(2t^3+3)-t=0$.
answer3: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $\frac{x}{2t^3+1}-3t=0$.
answer4: The integral curve that satisfies the initial condition is the curve $x=\frac{2t^3+1}{3t}$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Indicate which of the following is a subspace of $\mathbb{R}^3$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system, given the values of the parameters $\alpha,\beta,\gamma\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
-x &- &4y &- &4z &= &\alpha \\ 
x &- &3y &- &z &= &\beta \\ 
2x &+ &4y &+ &z &= &\gamma
\end{cases}$$
answer1: For every choice of $\alpha,\beta,\gamma\in\mathbb{R}$, the linear system has a unique solution, which is $\left(\frac{-\alpha+12\beta+8\gamma}{29},\,\frac{3\alpha-7\beta+5\gamma}{29},\,\frac{-10\alpha+4\beta-7\gamma}{29}\right)$.
answer2: The system has no solution for $\alpha=\beta=\gamma=0$, and for all other choices of $\alpha,\beta,\gamma\mathbb{R}$ the system has a unique solution which is $\left(\alpha+3\beta-\gamma,\,\gamma,\,\beta-\gamma\right)$.
answer3: The sistem has no solutions for every choice of $\alpha,\beta,\gamma \in \mathbb{R}$.
answer4: For every choice of $\alpha,\beta,\gamma \in \mathbb{R}$, the system has infinite solutions, which are $\left(\alpha-\beta+\gamma+z,\,1+z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

x & + & 2y & - & 3z & = & 4 \\

question:
Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, $f(x,y,z)=x^{2}+3yz^{2}+xe^{yz}$ and the point $a=\left( 1,-1,1\right) .$ 

Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a),\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(a)$ and $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a).$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6+e^{-1}$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3-e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2-e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=-3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

$\begin{cases}
y_{1}'-y_{1}-y_{2}=-\cos (x) \\
y_{2}'+2y_{1}+y_{2}=\sin (x)+\cos( x)
\end{cases}$
which satisfies the initial conditions 
$y_{1}(0)=1$ and $y_{2}(0)=-2$.
answer3:
$\begin{cases}
y_{1}(x)=(1-x)\cos x+\sin x\\
y_{2}(x)=(x-2)\cos x-x\sin x
\end{cases}$

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$

Suppose that each unit maintained at plants $A$, $B$ and $C$ has a penalty cost (in monetary units) of $0.5$, $1$ and $1$, respectively. question:
Consider the basis $A = \{(1,0), (0,1)\}$ and $B =\{(1,2), (-4, -3)\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$. 
Then the base change matrix from the base $B$ to the base $A$ and the base change matrix from the base $A$ to the base $B$ are respectively:
Indicate the coordinate vector of $w=(2,-3)$ relative to the basis $S=\left\{(2,-2), (0,3)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^2$.

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question: Find the relative extrema of the function $f$: $\mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$,  $f(x)=2x^3-12x^2$.
answer1: $x=0$ is a maximizer, and $x=4$ is a minimizer.
answer2: $x=1$ is a maximizer, and $x=4$ is a minimizer.
answer3: $x=0$ is a maximizer, and $x=2$ is a minimizer.
